title: Introduction to DevOps and CICD
description: DevOps is a cultural movement and set of best practices that promotes communication and collaboration between software developers and IT operations staff to automate the process of software delivery and increase the value of delivery throughout the software development lifecycle. Continuous Integration (CI) is the process of automatically detecting, pulling, building, and unit testing source code changes, while Continuous Delivery automatically releases verified code to the repository, and Continuous Deployment automates the release of applications to production environments. CICD is an implementation of the DevOps culture that allows organizations to automate and speed up the delivery process, reducing communication costs and the cost of errors.
